abstract.text: An object that describes a point of interest on the template’s map and in its scrollable picker.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A point of interest describes a geographical location on a map. It also provides supplementary information about the location, such as a title and summary that the template displays in a scrollable picker and on a detail card. A point of interest also provides the buttons the detail card presents to the user as contextual actions.
, or whenever the visible region of the template’s map changes, by calling the template’s
displays a maximum of twelve points of interest.

abstract.text: Integrate CarPlay in apps related to audio, communication, navigation, parking, EV charging, food ordering, and more.
An object that describes a point of interest on the template’s map and in its scrollable picker.
The detail card’s subtitle.

The detail card’s title.
Creates a point of interest for a specific location.
The map item that contains the point of interest’s geographical information.
A custom image that the map annotation displays.
The detail card’s primary action button.
The detail card’s secondary action button.
The subtitle that the picker’s item displays.
The summary that the picker’s item displays.
The title that the picker’s item displays.
An opaque value for the point of interest.
A template that displays a map with selectable points of interest.
Creates a Point of Interest template with a title, the points of interest to display, and the initial selection’s index.
Updates the points of interest and the current selection.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
